name: shimmied
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
shimmy
to do a dance in which you shake your hips and shoulders: She shimmied across the dance floor.
[ + adv/prep ] mainly UK (US usually shin, shinny) to climb smoothly up, down, or along something by holding it tightly with your arms and legs: He could shimmy up a drainpipe with ease. Workers on the roof shimmied down ladders.
[ + adv/prep ] US to move up and down and from side to side with small, quick movements, especially in order to put on or take off clothes: Every woman has had that moment of elation when she shimmies into something a size smaller than usual. She shimmied out of that brown dress while her daughter was still fiddling with buttons.
US If a car shimmies, it makes a very light shaking movement that is not the usual movement of the car.
